keyEvents.title: Coffee Monkeys Attack the Thousand Sunny
keyEvents.description: At Grove 44, the Coffee Monkeys attempt to capture the Thousand Sunny to claim a Marine reward, but are defeated by Duval's Rosy Life Riders.
keyEvents.significance: Shows that the Thousand Sunny remains at Sabaody being protected during the crew's separation.

description: The archipelago where the Thousand Sunny is docked and being protected by Duval's crew during the Straw Hats' separation.

keyEvents.title: Chopper Understands the Message
keyEvents.description: Chopper, sitting on a giant bird in Torino Kingdom, receives the newspaper and immediately understands Luffy's 3D2Y message.
keyEvents.significance: Shows Chopper's current training location and his successful comprehension of the coded message.

description: The island of giant birds where Chopper is currently located, learning about the native medicine and creatures.

keyEvents.title: Nami Understands the Message
keyEvents.description: While attempting to escape Weatheria, Nami is stopped by Haredas who shows her the newspaper. She quickly understands the message but complains about Luffy's unilateral decision.
keyEvents.significance: Shows Nami's current location and her characteristic blend of intelligence and emotional response.

description: The sky island where Nami is studying weather science with the wizard Haredas.

keyEvents.title: Sanji Understands the Message
keyEvents.description: Despite his difficult circumstances surrounded by okama in the Kamabakka Kingdom, Sanji successfully deciphers Luffy's coded message.
keyEvents.significance: Shows Sanji's current predicament and his mental sharpness despite adverse conditions.

description: The okama kingdom where Sanji is currently trapped, surrounded by cross-dressing martial artists.

keyEvents.title: Usopp Gets the Message
keyEvents.description: After another failed escape attempt from the Boin Archipelago, Usopp receives the newspaper while eating and understands Luffy's message.
keyEvents.significance: Shows Usopp's ongoing struggles with the carnivorous island while maintaining his connection to the crew.

description: A dangerous island of carnivorous plants where Usopp is currently stranded, struggling to escape.

keyEvents.title: Robin Deciphers the Message
keyEvents.description: Riding in a horse-drawn carriage in Tequila Wolf, Robin reads the newspaper and calmly understands Luffy's coded instruction.
keyEvents.significance: Shows Robin's current location and her characteristic calm intelligence in decoding messages.

description: A massive bridge under construction where Robin was initially enslaved before being freed by the Revolutionary Army.

keyEvents.title: Franky Understands Despite Damage
keyEvents.description: On Karakuri Island, severely damaged from the explosion at Vegapunk's laboratory, Franky successfully deciphers Luffy's message.
keyEvents.significance: Shows Franky's current damaged state and the site of Vegapunk's former laboratory where he will study.

description: The futuristic island that was once Dr. Vegapunk's birthplace and laboratory, now where Franky will study advanced technology.

keyEvents.title: Zoro Fails to Understand
keyEvents.description: On the gloomy Kuraigana Island with Perona, Zoro completely fails to decipher Luffy's 3D2Y message due to his poor directional sense and denseness.
keyEvents.significance: Provides comedic relief and confirms Zoro as the 'dull' crew member Rayleigh mentioned, while showing his training location.

description: The gloomy island ruled by Mihawk where Zoro is currently training, also home to Perona and humandrills.

keyEvents.title: Brook Imprisoned
keyEvents.description: Brook is shown imprisoned on Namakura Island, muttering about needing to escape his current situation.
keyEvents.significance: Establishes Brook's predicament and need to escape captivity to reunite with the crew.

description: The island where Brook is imprisoned after his skeleton appearance caused panic among the locals.

keyEvents.title: Dadan Cries for Ace
keyEvents.description: Near Windmill Village, the Dadan Family goes to Ace and Luffy's old treehouse, crying out to Ace's spirit that Luffy is alive.
keyEvents.significance: Emotional scene showing the village's grief over Ace and relief at Luffy's survival.

description: Luffy's home village in the East Blue, where he was raised alongside Ace and Sabo.

keyEvents.title: Dadan Family at the Treehouse
keyEvents.description: The Dadan Family climbs Mt. Colubo to reach Ace and Luffy's old treehouse, where they cry out to Ace's spirit.
keyEvents.significance: The treehouse serves as a memorial site where those who knew Ace can process their grief.

description: The mountain near Windmill Village where Dadan's hideout and Ace and Luffy's treehouse are located.

keyEvents.title: Vivi Reads the News
keyEvents.description: In Arabasta, Princess Vivi receives the news about Luffy with joy but becomes confused trying to decipher the meaning of his arm tattoo.
keyEvents.significance: Shows Vivi's continued connection to the Straw Hat Pirates and her emotional investment in their wellbeing.

description: The desert kingdom ruled by the Nefertari family, where Vivi lives as princess.
